title: Julio César Suazo
text:
Julio César Suazo Bernárdez (born 5 October 1978) is a retired Honduran <a href="soccer">football</a> <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a>.
Club career.
Nicknamed "Pungui", Suazo came through the youth ranks at <a href="C.D.%20Victoria">Victoria</a> and moved to Europe in 2000 to play for <a href="FC%20Red%20Bull%20Salzburg">SV Wüstenrot Salzburg</a> alongside compatriots <a href="Maynor%20Suazo">Maynor Suazo</a> and <a href="Juan%20Manuel%20C%C3%A1rcamo">Juan Manuel Cárcamo</a>. He also had spells at <a href="Real%20C.D.%20Espa%C3%B1a">Real España</a>, whom he left for <a href="Hispano%20F.C.">Hispano</a> before the 2007 Clausura, as well as at Turkish third division side Eğirdir Belediye Spor where he played alongside compatriot <a href="Francisco%20Antonio%20Pav%C3%B3n">Francisco Antonio Pavón</a>. Also, he played a few games for Chilean side <a href="CD%20Huachipato">Huachipato</a>.
He finally returned to Honduras and joined Savio during the 2009 Apertura after a delay in the release by the Turkish federation, but was the third player to leave the club in September 2009 for not paying his wages. He played the 2011 Clausura for <a href="Heredia%20Jaguares%20de%20Peten">Heredia</a> in Guatemala.
In December 2012, he announced he would retire after the 2013 Clausura but after scoring an own goal against <a href="C.D.S.%20Vida">Vida</a> in March 2013, he quit immediately and declared to pursue a coaching career.
International career.
He was part of the Honduras U-17 squad at the <a href="1994%20CONCACAF%20U-17%20Tournament">1994 CONCACAF U-17 Tournament</a>. In 1996, Suazo was part of the Honduras U-20 squad at the <a href="1996%20CONCACAF%20U-20%20Tournament">CONCACAF U20 championship</a> in Mexico.
Suazo made his senior debut for <a href="Honduras%20national%20football%20team">Honduras</a> in a May 1999 <a href="friendly%20match">friendly match</a> against <a href="Haiti%20national%20football%20team">Haiti</a> and has earned a total of 4 caps, scoring no goals. He has represented his country at the <a href="2000%20Summer%20Olympics">2000 Summer Olympics</a>.
His final international was a June 2003 friendly match against <a href="Venezuela%20national%20football%20team">Venezuela</a>.
